neighbors.name: Bureau Of Land Management
neighbors.claims: The Bureau of Land Management (BLM) is a federal agency managing public lands; its Four Rivers Field Office oversees approximately 1.3 million acres in southwest Idaho [Bureau of Land Management](https://www.blm.gov/office/four-rivers-field-office). Federal BLM lands are exempt from local property taxes, but the agency provides Payment in Lieu of Taxes (PILT) to Payette County to support local services [DOI](https://www.doi.gov/pilt). The field office actively processes renewable energy applications under a 2023 Renewable Energy Strategy and the 2023 Resource Management Plan [BLM](https://www.blm.gov/sites/default/files/docs/2023-09/BLM_Idaho_RenewableEnergyReport_FINAL.pdf).
neighbors.influence_justification: Federal land manager controlling 1.3M acres and permitting rights-of-way

approach_recommendations.engage: Submit SF-299 application to the Four Rivers Field Office. Early engagement must address the 2023 Resource Management Plan and sage-grouse habitat conservation.

citations.claim: Four Rivers Field Office oversees approximately 1.3 million acres in southwest Idaho
citations.title: Four Rivers Field Office | Bureau of Land Management

citations.claim: Federal BLM lands are exempt from local property taxes, with counties instead receiving Payment in Lieu of Taxes (PILT) funds
citations.title: Payment in Lieu of Taxes

citations.claim: The field office actively processes renewable energy applications under a 2023 Renewable Energy Strategy
citations.title: BLM Idaho Renewable Energy Strategy

neighbors.name: Lone Pine Farms Canyon County LLC
neighbors.claims: Lone Pine Farms Canyon County LLC is an agricultural entity governed by members of the Boschma family, specifically Joel S., Deborah L., Lisa M., and Stephen T. Boschma, who are also associated with the general partnership Lone Pine Dairy ([Canyon County Sheriff](https://www.canyoncounty.id.gov/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/25-000795-NOSS-LONE-PINE-DAIRY.pdf)). In Payette County, the entity developed a major livestock facility along Big Willow Creek, described in real estate records as a 14,534-head Confined Animal Feeding Operation (CAFO) and feedlot situated on approximately 890 acres ([RJ Realty](https://www.rjrealty.com/-/listing/ID-SIRMLS/98916193/6075-Big-Willow-Rd-Payette-ID-83661)). The operation faced significant financial restructuring; in early 2025, the entity and its principals were defendants in a lawsuit brought by Rooster Capital IV LLC, resulting in a Judgment, Decree of Foreclosure, and a Sheriff's Sale of their associated real property in neighboring Canyon County ([Canyon County Sheriff](https://www.canyoncounty.id.gov/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/25-000795-NOSS-LONE-PINE-DAIRY.pdf)). Property records indicate the entity's primary Payette County holdings (6075 Big Willow Rd) were sold to Rown Investments LLC, a separate investment entity ([Homes.com](https://www.homes.com/property/6075-big-willow-rd-payette-id/beswyvfcm8vfe/)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Historical operator of one of the largest feedlots in the county (14,000+ head capacity), giving them significant past influence in the local agricultural sector, though recent foreclosure proceedings and property sales indicate a loss of operational control.

approach_recommendations.engage: Do not engage the LLC for long-term agreements as they appear to have liquidated key assets. Direct outreach should be pivoted to the new owners of the Big Willow Road assemblage (Rown Investments LLC) or legal representatives handling the receivership/foreclosure estate if any parcels remain under the Boschma family's control.

neighbors.profile_summary: Family-run agricultural entity that operated a large-scale CAFO in Payette County. The entity has recently undergone foreclosure proceedings and asset liquidation, selling major holdings to an investment firm.

citations.claim: Governed by members of the Boschma family (Joel S., Deborah L., Lisa M., Stephen T.) and associated with Lone Pine Dairy
citations.title: Notice of Sheriff's Sale Case No. CV14-24-08163

citations.claim: Developed a 14,534-head Confined Animal Feeding Operation (CAFO) on ~890 acres in Payette County
citations.title: 6075 Big Willow Rd Listing Details

citations.claim: Defendants in foreclosure lawsuit by Rooster Capital IV LLC resulting in Sheriff's Sale
citations.title: Notice of Sheriff's Sale Case No. CV14-24-08163

citations.claim: Payette County holdings sold to Rown Investments LLC

neighbors.name: Big Willow Ranch LLC
neighbors.claims: Big Willow Ranch LLC operates a significant agricultural enterprise in Payette County, centered around a farm and feedlot operation along Big Willow Creek [Clearwater Properties](https://www.rjrealty.com/-/listing/ID-SIRMLS/98916193/6075-Big-Willow-Rd-Payette-ID-83661). The property covers approximately 889 acres and includes an existing 4,000-head feedlot, with a CAFO permit authorizing expansion up to 14,534 head [Zillow](https://www.zillow.com/homedetails/6075-Big-Willow-Rd-Payette-ID-83661/96906304_zpid/). In addition to livestock, the ranch operates 'Butte Lodge,' a private facility offering guided elk hunts on the property [Ultimate Elk Hunting Directory](https://www.ultimateelkhunting.com/business/butte-lodge/). The entity has a documented history of legal litigation regarding its resources and operations. In 2024, Big Willow Ranch LLC filed a petition for judicial review against the Idaho Department of Water Resources regarding the forfeiture of water rights [Idaho Dept. of Water Resources](https://idwr.idaho.gov/legal-actions/district-court-actions/big-willow-v-idwr/). Furthermore, in April 2025, the company filed a contract dispute lawsuit in federal court against Western Oilfields Supply Company (dba Rain for Rent) [Justia](https://dockets.justia.com/docket/idaho/iddce/1:2025cv00209/56784).
neighbors.influence_justification: The entity controls a substantial agricultural operation with significant permitted expansion capacity (14,534 head CAFO) and demonstrates high legal sophistication and willingness to litigate to protect resource rights.

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage leadership directly with a focus on resource preservation. Given their active litigation against IDWR regarding water rights, any discussion must explicitly guarantee no impact on their water availability or quality. The existence of the hunting lodge suggests the need to address visual/construction impacts on wildlife patterns.

neighbors.profile_summary: Big Willow Ranch LLC is a major agricultural and recreational operator in the county, managing a large feedlot with significant expansion permits and a commercial hunting lodge. They are legally active and protective of their water and property rights.

citations.claim: The property covers approximately 889 acres and includes an existing 4,000-head feedlot, with a CAFO permit authorizing expansion up to 14,534 head
citations.title: 6075 Big Willow Rd Property Details

neighbors.name: Willows Ranch LLC
neighbors.claims: Willows Ranch LLC is a property owning entity in Payette County, with records linking it to a parcel on Little Willow Road [Homes.com](https://www.homes.com/property/5415-little-willow-rd-payette-id/j3666sp06537z/). Public records indicate the LLC is associated with an address in Steamboat Springs, Colorado, suggesting absentee ownership [Routt County Permits](https://cityview2.iharriscomputer.com/RouttCountyPortal/Permit/GetFile/118128). The entity appears to be distinct from the local 'Big Willow Ranch' operation. While the entity controls property in the Little Willow Creek area, specific details regarding the scale of agricultural operations under this specific LLC are limited in available public records.
neighbors.influence_justification: Appears to be an absentee owner (Colorado address) with limited visible presence or political activity in local Payette County records compared to other large ranching entities.

approach_recommendations.engage: Treat as an absentee landowner/investor. Initial outreach should be directed to the registered address in Steamboat Springs, CO. Focus on property value protection and minimal disturbance, as they likely do not reside on-site.

neighbors.profile_summary: Willows Ranch LLC appears to be a land-holding entity with ties to Steamboat Springs, Colorado, indicating absentee ownership. They own property on Little Willow Road but do not show the same level of local operational footprint as neighboring ranches.

citations.claim: Willows Ranch LLC is a property owning entity in Payette County, with records linking it to a parcel on Little Willow Road
citations.title: Property Record for 5415 Little Willow Rd

citations.claim: Public records indicate the LLC is associated with an address in Steamboat Springs, Colorado
citations.title: Routt County Permit Record listing Willows Ranch LLC

neighbors.name: Peterson Richard M 2016 Family Trust
neighbors.claims: This parcel is held by the Richard M. Peterson 2016 Family Trust. Richard M. Peterson, a long-time resident of Payette, passed away in March 2025 at the age of 93 [Legacy.com](https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/name/richard-peterson-obituary?id=57999117). Control of the trust assets, including this property, has likely passed to successor trustees or heirs. No specific stance on renewable development is recorded for the trust or the late Mr. Peterson.
neighbors.influence_justification: Original landowner is deceased (2025); current decision-making authority is in transition or held by successor trustees whose influence is currently unknown.

approach_recommendations.engage: Identify the successor trustee or executor of the Richard M. Peterson estate. The property may be in a period of transition following the owner's 2025 passing, which could present opportunities for lease or purchase if the heirs are looking to liquidate or monetize assets.

neighbors.profile_summary: The property is held by a family trust associated with Richard M. Peterson, who died in 2025. The land is likely in a probate or transitional management phase.

citations.claim: Richard M. Peterson, a long-time resident of Payette, passed away in March 2025 at the age of 93
citations.title: Obituary for Richard Peterson

neighbors.name: DJS Properties L.P.
neighbors.claims: DJS Properties, L.P. is a Simplot family limited partnership formed in 1997 by Don J. Simplot, initially holding significant family assets including stock and real estate([Justia](https://law.justia.com/cases/federal/district-courts/idaho/iddce/1:2007cv00484/21493/14/)). The partnership holds title to agricultural properties in Payette County, as confirmed by Idaho Department of Water Resources service lists and oil/gas permitting records from the Idaho Oil and Gas Conservation Commission([IDWR](https://idwr.idaho.gov/wp-content/uploads/sites/2/districts/Declaration-of-Proof-of-Service.pdf)). Historically, the entity was central to litigation during Don Simplot's 2007 bankruptcy, where family members successfully opposed the liquidation of DJS assets, arguing it would violate the partnership agreement([US Courts](https://www.id.uscourts.gov/content_fetcher/decision.cfml/In_re_Simplot_1786.pdf?Decision_ID=1786)). The entity has also engaged in land use applications in other Idaho counties, such as a record of survey application in Valley County to adjust lot lines for family trust properties([Valley County](https://evogov.s3.amazonaws.com/media/141/media/147325.pdf)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Entity is a primary land-holding vehicle for the prominent Simplot agribusiness family, which holds immense economic and political sway in Idaho.

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage via Simplot family representatives or legal counsel; acknowledge the entity's history of protecting family assets and structure proposals to align with long-term holding strategies.

neighbors.profile_summary: Simplot family limited partnership with verified agricultural holdings in Payette County. History of aggressive legal defense to protect partnership assets from liquidation.

citations.claim: Formed in 1997 by Don J. Simplot
citations.title: In Re Don J. Simplot - Memorandum Decision

citations.claim: Owner of Payette County agricultural parcels
citations.title: IDWR Declaration of Proof of Service

citations.claim: Bankruptcy litigation regarding asset liquidation
citations.title: US Bankruptcy Court Decision - Don J. Simplot

citations.claim: Land use applications in Valley County
citations.title: McCall Area Planning and Zoning Commission Minutes

neighbors.name: B Humble Farms LLC
neighbors.claims: B Humble Farms LLC is an Idaho limited liability company associated with the Boschma family and Lone Pine Dairy operations([Canyon County](https://www.canyoncounty.id.gov/wp-content/uploads/2025/03/25-000794-NOSS-LONE-PINE-DAIRY-002.pdf)). Public records indicate recent financial litigation; the entity was named as a co-defendant alongside Lone Pine Dairy in a 2025 foreclosure action and Sheriff's Sale notice involving agricultural real property in neighboring Canyon County([Canyon County](https://www.canyoncounty.id.gov/wp-content/uploads/2025/03/25-000794-NOSS-LONE-PINE-DAIRY-002.pdf)). This legal activity suggests the entity functions as part of a broader family agricultural enterprise rather than a standalone small holding. No specific public stance on renewable energy development has been documented for this entity.
neighbors.influence_justification: Entity is involved in active foreclosure litigation, potentially limiting community leverage; influence is tied to the Boschma family dairy operations which are facing financial challenges.

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach with extreme sensitivity regarding current legal challenges; any lease offers may be viewed as a welcome financial opportunity, but title/ownership stability must be verified immediately.

neighbors.profile_summary: Boschma family agricultural entity currently navigating foreclosure litigation as of early 2025. Closely tied to Lone Pine Dairy operations.

citations.claim: Named co-defendant in foreclosure/Sheriff's sale 2025
citations.title: Amended Notice of Sheriff's Sale - Rooster Capital IV LLC vs Lone Pine Dairy et al

citations.claim: Association with Boschma family
citations.title: Notice of Sheriff's Sale Case No. CV14-24-08163

neighbors.name: Horst Land LLC
neighbors.claims: Horst Land LLC is an Idaho agricultural entity managed by Bruce Horst, with a registered mailing address in Payette([Elementix](https://elementix.ai/investors/id/bruce-horst)). The entity actively manages crop production, evidenced by multiple crop residue burning permits issued by the Idaho Department of Environmental Quality for corn and bean fields in Payette County between 2020 and 2025([Idaho DEQ](https://www2.deq.idaho.gov/air/CRB/BurnApprovals/FinalBurnApprovalPdf/8568)). Bruce Horst is also listed in state financial records as a vendor or recipient of state funds([Idaho SCO](https://www.sco.idaho.gov/SiteAssets/Pages/Luma-Projects-&-Grants/AR%20Customer%20List%20-%2010.21.2021.xlsx)). There is no record of the entity taking a public position on zoning or development matters in county hearing minutes.
neighbors.influence_justification: Active local agricultural operator focused on crop production (corn/beans); no evidence of broader political leadership or board roles.

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage Bruce Horst directly as an active operator; discussions should focus on minimizing impact to active planting/harvesting schedules and residue management practices.

neighbors.profile_summary: Active agricultural operation managed by Bruce Horst. Verified production of corn and beans with recent state permits.

citations.claim: Managed by Bruce Horst
citations.title: Horst Land LLC Entity Details

citations.claim: DEQ Crop Residue Burning Permits (Corn/Beans)
citations.title: Idaho DEQ Burn Permit 2025-59-1

citations.claim: State financial records listing
citations.title: Idaho State Controller AR Customer List

overview_summary: Screening identified eight organizational entities and zero individual residents, including three high-influence and one medium-influence neighbor. These stakeholders are primarily large-scale agricultural and ranching operations, such as a federal agency and major landholders like Big Willow Ranch LLC and DJS Properties LP, which is tied to the prominent Simplot family. While one entity is neutral and seven remain unknown, their interests center on land preservation and water resources, with no current recorded opposition to development.
